summary: Email correspondence from October 2021 regarding an inquiry from the Russian Embassy about a Russian citizen (referred to as Jane Doe) who filed a lawsuit related to the Epstein case, claiming to be a victim of sexual crimes. The U.S. officials state they are unfamiliar with the individual or lawsuit and are working to confirm details.

persons.name: Igor Sergeev
persons.role: Head of Legal Division, Embassy of the Russian Federation in the USA
persons.context: Sent an inquiry on behalf of the Russian Embassy regarding a Russian citizen (Jane Doe) who filed a lawsuit in the Epstein case, seeking information about nationals involved.

events.title: Russian Embassy Inquiry on Epstein Case
events.description: The Russian Embassy sent an inquiry to U.S. officials regarding a Russian citizen (referred to as Jane Doe) who filed a lawsuit related to the Epstein case, claiming to be a victim of sexual crimes, and requested information about Russian nationals involved.

locations: Embassy of the Russian Federation in the USA
keyFacts: The Russian Embassy inquired about a Russian citizen (referred to as Jane Doe) who filed a lawsuit related to the Epstein case, claiming to be a victim of sexual crimes.
U.S. officials responded that they were unfamiliar with the individual or lawsuit and were working to confirm details.
The inquiry highlights international interest and potential involvement of Russian nationals in the Epstein case.
The correspondence occurred in October 2021, indicating ongoing legal or diplomatic activity related to the Epstein case years after his death.
